attributes.action: Immigrants don't deserve degrading, they are humans like everyone...
attributes.additional_details:
Further submissions opportunity provided in HO Decision under Section 120 needed to be considered as official correspondence. My further submissions ignored by HO not for one time but for 8 times. This is degrading treatment because there is no law to ignore them.

When I submitted them again through new visa application form under ECHR Article 3, 8 & 13, HO ignored whole part of ECHR claims and refused application which is unlawful act and this petition needs to be responded by Government.
attributes.background: When an immigrant claims their human rights under ECHR articles through visa application form, they needed to be treated and considered carefully. Ignoring them again and again is unlawful for a law enforcement department.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could start a new petition asking for a specific change in the visa application process, if that's what you want to happen.
